content: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain till October 5 owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
content: For October 2, it has issued a ‚ÄòRed‚Äô warning of above 20-cm rainfall in Puri and Jagstingpur districts, an ‚ÄòOrange‚Äô warning (7 cm to 20 cm rain) for 14 districts, and a ‚ÄòYellow‚Äô warning (7 cm to 11 cm rain) for the remaining 14 districts

title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

title: Neighbour Shoots Man With Air Gun In Delhi, Arrested
content: A 37-year-old man was injured after being shot at with an air gun allegedly by his neighbour in southwest Delhi's Sagarpur area on Wednesday, police said.

title: Rajesh Agrawal Takes Charge As Commerce Secretary
content: Senior IAS officer Rajesh Agrawal on Wednesday assumed charge as Secretary, Department of Commerce, an official statement said.

title: 'India's Trade Pact With European Countries Comes Into Force': Piyush Goyal
content: The free trade agreement between India and the four European nations bloc EFTA has come into force, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday.

title: Rs 2000 Notes Worth Rs 5,884 Crore Still In Circulation, Says RBI
content: The high-value Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore are still in circulation, according to official data released on Wednesday.

title: Indian-Origin Couple 'Deliberately Starved' 3-Year-Old Baby To Death: UK Court
content: An Indian-origin couple who were charged with the murder of their three-year-old daughter nearly two years ago by the Metropolitan Police have been accused of "deliberately starving" the toddler at a court hearing in London.

title: Pak Army Chief Branded 'Salesman' After Rare Earth Pic With Trump Goes Viral
content: Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff, Field Marshal Asim Munir, is facing a storm of criticism after his latest high-profile visit to Washington, which was his third in less than six months.

title: 5 Survivors Pulled From Indonesia School Rubble As Rescuers Race Against Time
content: Rescuers pulled five survivors from a collapsed school in Indonesia as frantic parents demanded searchers speed up efforts to find dozens of children believed still trapped in the rubble two days on.

title: Seven UK Grooming Gang Members Jailed For 12-35 years
content: Seven members of a grooming gang in northern England were jailed for between 12 and 35 years, the latest sentences stemming from a decades-spanning scandal across several cities.

title: In UP, Brother Kills Brother Over Garbage, Takes Help From Wife
content: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur was killed with an axe by his younger brother and sister-in-law following an argument over throwing garbage.

title: 260 Members Of Moroccan Security Forces Hurt As 'Genz 212' Protests Turn Violent
content: Youth protests in cities across Morocco turned far more violent on the fourth night of unrest, with 263 members of the security forces and 23 civilians injured as demonstrators torched cars and ransacked shops.

title: Sex Toy, Obscene CDs: Delhi Sleaze Baba Saga Gets Murkier
content: The saga of self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati is getting ever murkier with the Delhi police recovering a sex toy and some CDs, suspected to contain obscene videos.

title: Woman Caused Shooter Hoax At US Military Base To Bond With Co-workers
content: A scare about a supposed shooting that prompted a lockdown at New Jersey's largest military base was a hoax caused by a civilian employee who wanted to "trauma bond" with her colleagues.

title: Madhya Pradesh Man Bleeds Outside Police Station While Cops Get Car Washed
content: Daboh police station in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district has once again brought the police under sharp criticism, with an incident that residents described as the height of negligence and insensitivity.

title: Locked Up By 'Upper Caste' Women For Entering Home, Dalit Boy Dies By Suicide
content: A 12-year-old Dalit boy allegedly died by suicide by consuming poison after he was reportedly locked inside a cowshed by some so-called 'upper caste' women for entering their house at a village in Shimla district, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Mobile, Data Networks Return Across Afghanistan
content: Mobile networks returned to several provinces across Afghanistan, including the capital Kabul, 48 hours after the Taliban authorities shut down telecommunications.

title: After Heavy Russian Shelling, Zelensky Says Nuclear Plant At Risk
content: Ukraine's president and the UN nuclear agency head are sounding the alarm about increased safety risks at the Russia-occupied Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in southern Ukraine, which lost its external power supply more than a week ago.

title: US, Allies Reducing Forces In Iraq: Pentagon
content: US and allied forces are reducing their presence in Iraq, the Pentagon said, winding down a more than decade-long mission there against the Islamic State as planned.

title: Meta To Use AI Chats To Personalise Content, Ads From December
content: Meta Platforms said it would begin using people's interactions with its generative AI tools to personalize content and advertising across its apps such as Facebook and Instagram starting on December 16.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' Row: 2 'Outsiders' With Criminal History Arrested After Encounter
content: Two persons allegedly involved in the September 26 violence in Bareilly were arrested following an encounter in CB Ganj area on Wednesday, police said, as the crackdown continued on suspected rioters and its support providers.

content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

content: Though Mr. Singh‚Äôs stance is at odds with the Congress‚Äôs official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap‚Äôs death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting ‚Äúself-immolation‚Äù to people of Ladakh on ‚Äúmultiple occasions‚Äù on ‚Äúlines of protests in Tibet‚Äù

content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State‚Äôs total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk‚Äôs release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk‚Äôs wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‚Äòtariff terrorism‚Äô will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: US govt shuts down: Donald Trump vs Democrats - who will blink first?
content: The US government has shut down after Congress failed to pass a stopgap funding bill, marking the first closure since 2019. Democrats demand extending Affordable Care Act subsidies, while Republicans insist on a clean bill. This standoff threatens 750,000 federal workers and could significantly impact the economy and health care costs, with both parties digging in for a prolonged fight.

title: Trophy row: Controversy deepens! Naqvi sets strange conditions for India
content: ACC Chairman Mohsin Naqvi, also Pakistan Cricket Board chief, challenged the Indian team to collect their Asia Cup trophy from his office, vehemently denying any apology to BCCI officials. This follows controversy over the presentation ceremony where Indians reportedly refused the trophy from him.

title: US govt shutdown: How it may impact immigration, travel process
content: The US government shutdown has begun, creating uncertainty for immigration processes. While USCIS and most Department of State visa/passport services remain operational, the Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification has ceased all functions. This halt prevents the filing of crucial LCAs and PERM applications, significantly delaying H-1B and green card processes until the shutdown concludes.

title: 'Tariffs to help farmers': Trump announces meeting with Xi; US soybeans in focus
content: Donald Trump announced plans to use tariff revenue to aid American soybean farmers, who are suffering because China has halted purchases for "negotiating" reasons. He criticized Joe Biden for not enforcing a trade agreement and vowed to address the issue with Xi Jinping, as China now buys from Brazil and Argentina.

title: 'Perils of talking ...': Chidambaram on row over his 26/11 remarks; blames media
content: Former Union Home Minister P Chidambaram refuted media claims that the US directly prevented India's military retaliation post-26/11, stating he was misquoted. He clarified that while he favored retribution, international diplomatic pressure, notably from then-US Secretary Condoleezza Rice, influenced the Manmohan Singh government against physical action.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won‚Äôt be updated until‚Ä¶
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: J&K: Searches in Kathua after suspicious border movements; footprint traced
content: Security forces launched extensive searches in Juthana Rajbagh, Kathua, following reports of three suspicious individuals, one with a heavy backpack. J&K police and BSF are combing the area along the Ujh river near the Pakistan border. Footprints confirm movement, though no suspects have been apprehended yet. This operation follows a fierce gunbattle in the same vicinity this March.

title: J&K: Govt teacher booked under POCSO Act in Rajouri; at large after suspension
content: A government school teacher in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district was suspended and booked under the POCSO Act on Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student. Students staged protests following the incident, which ceased after the teacher's suspension and an FIR. The accused, Ajaz Ahmad, is currently absconding, prompting a police manhunt. This grave allegation has sparked significant concern.

title: 'Haven't spoken to husband till now': Wangchuk's wife writes to Prez; makes urgent appeal
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Gitanjali Angmo, appealed to President Droupadi Murmu for her husband's unconditional release. Wangchuk was arrested under the National Security Act and moved to Jodhpur, accused of inciting violence during Ladakh protests demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule status. Angmo alleges a "witch hunt" against him for his advocacy.

title: Bill Gates‚Äô personality shift: How his daughter helped; forced him to talk to people
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' youngest daughter, revealed how she actively helped her shy father overcome his awkwardness from a young age. She recounted pushing him to socialize at events, even father-daughter dances. Phoebe also shared their intense competitive streak, particularly when she introduces new boyfriends, and how she navigates being recognized as "Bill's daughter" by embracing her own identity.

title: Shocking! ILT20 2025 Auction: Ravichandran Ashwin goes unsold
content: Veteran Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, 38, surprisingly went unsold at the ILT20 2025 auction in Dubai, despite his USD 120,000 base price. His snub shocked many, given his stellar career and recent retirement from international and IPL cricket, which had made his availability a significant talking point. This unexpected turn of events has left many questioning the auction dynamics.

title: 'Ready to hand over Asia Cup trophy': Naqvi says 'never apologised' to BCCI
content: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi fiercely refuted claims of apologising to BCCI regarding the Asia Cup trophy, accusing Indian media of "fabricated propaganda." This controversy stems from India's refusal to accept the trophy from Naqvi after their victory, citing geopolitical tensions. Reports indicate Naqvi initially avoided acknowledging India's triumph, leaving the champions without their prize and escalating the cricket-politics dispute.

title: Aishwarya, Abhishek vs Google: Bachchans take YouTube to court; AI threat
content: Bollywood stars Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan sued YouTube over AI-generated deepfakes misusing their personas. They demand content removal and safeguards to prevent their likeness from training AI models without consent, citing concerns about misleading information. This landmark case in India seeks $450,000 in damages and a permanent injunction.

title: 'Deliberately starved' her to death: Indian-origin couple allegedly killed daughter in UK
content: An Indian-origin couple, Manpreet Jatana and Jaskiret Singh Uppal, are facing murder charges for allegedly deliberately starving their three-year-old daughter to death nearly two years ago. Police found the toddler's "emaciated" body in December 2023, with examinations confirming malnutrition and prolonged starvation as the cause. They remain in custody.

title: 'Any attack on Qatar ...': Trump warns Netanyahu; signs order after Israeli strike
content: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order guaranteeing Qatar's security, including potential military action if attacked. This action followed recent Israeli airstrikes on Qatar targeting Hamas leaders, which both Qatari and US officials condemned. The order declares an attack on Qatar a threat to US peace and security, raising questions given Israel's status as a US ally.

title: Fed board row: SC blocks Trump from firing Cook; hearing scheduled for Jan 2026
content: The Supreme Court blocked Donald Trump's immediate removal of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, ensuring she remains until January 2026 arguments. Trump accused Cook of mortgage fraud, but lower courts ruled her dismissal violated "for cause" requirements. This rare challenge to Fed independence highlights a broader legal battle over presidential authority to fire officials.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs extension in doubt after Kirill Kaprizov‚Äôs new deal
content: Connor McDavid's contract future with the Edmonton Oilers is under intense scrutiny following Kirill Kaprizov's massive deal. Despite McDavid's potential for a record-setting salary, the Oilers face significant cap challenges due to existing high-value contracts. McDavid prioritizes winning a Stanley Cup, suggesting he might accept less to ensure a competitive team, forcing Edmonton to find creative financial solutions.

title: Klay Thompson silent on Megan Thee Stallion, chasing Mavericks‚Äô goal
content: Dallas Mavericks' Klay Thompson targets a historic 50/40/90 shooting season, an elite benchmark, after deflecting personal questions at media day. His ambitious individual goal, combined with Kyrie Irving's crucial return from a torn ACL, is pivotal for the Mavericks' playoff aspirations in a highly competitive Western Conference. The team's success hinges on these key performances.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals her biggest fear after Dwyane Wade‚Äôs cancer diagnosis
content: Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer, admitting she worried about raising their children alone. His secrecy regarding his health decisions caused distrust, nearly bringing their marriage to rock bottom. Wade underwent surgery in December 2023 to remove 40% of his right kidney.

title: Watch: Pak police open fire at protesters in PoK; what sparked the unrest?
content: Pakistani forces allegedly opened fire on peaceful protestors in Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir, resulting in over six deaths since September 29. Demonstrations demanding self-rule have been met with tear gas, communication blackouts, and strict restrictions. A local leader accused Pakistan of militarizing the region and warned Islamabad to withdraw troops, threatening further unrest and demanding an end to violence against citizens.

title: Search op in J&K: Security forces deployed in Rajbagh sector; 3 suspects reported
content: Security forces launched a search operation in Kathua's Rajbagh sector after locals reported three suspicious individuals, one with a heavy backpack, near the International Border. The joint police and BSF team found footprints confirming movement along the Ujh river but made no arrests. This operation follows a similar recent search for alleged terror suspects in the district.

title: Happy Dussehra 2025: Top 50 Wishes, Messages, and Quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Dussehra, or Vijayadashami, is a vibrant Indian festival celebrating the triumph of good over evil, specifically Lord Rama's victory over Ravana. Observed on October 2, 2025, it features effigy burnings, fairs, and marks the end of Navratri. This festival promotes joy, new beginnings, and hope, reminding everyone that goodness always prevails.

title: Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner: A private love story lasting 15 years
content: Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner maintain a private relationship. Leutner began modeling in 2005, appearing in Sports Illustrated in 2011. She works with fashion brands. Crosby achieved significant hockey success. They met in 2008. Both built impressive careers. They prioritize privacy. Their bond thrives away from public attention.

title: Weight loss drug ‚ÄòOzempic‚Äô approved in India: Key health benefits and risks
content: India has officially approved Ozempic (semaglutide), a once-a-week injection for adults with type 2 diabetes, which also aids in weight loss. This GLP-1 receptor analogue helps control blood sugar, offers cardiovascular protection, and supports healthier eating habits. While promising for India's rising diabetes rates, users should be aware of potential side effects.

title: Rajvir Jawanda continues to be critical with no significant improvement - Report
content: Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda met with a bike accident in Solan District. He remains in critical condition five days later. Fortis Mohali confirmed no significant improvement in his health. The singer sustained head and spine injuries. Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann visited him in the hospital. Many Punjabi artists urged fans to pray for his recovery. Diljit Dosanjh also requested prayers during his concert.

title: Napheesa Collier blasts WNBA leadership after Lynx playoff collapse
content: WNBA star Napheesa Collier criticised league leadership for mismanagement and safety failures. She highlighted issues with rookie contracts and officiating. Commissioner Cathy Engelbert reportedly dismissed player concerns. Engelbert later responded, expressing respect for Collier but disagreeing with her characterisation of conversations. This exchange occurred before upcoming CBA discussions. The league faces scrutiny regarding player welfare and governance.

title: 'Moral cowardice': Cong attacks PM for backing Trump's Gaza plan - sets 4 posers
content: Jairam Ramesh criticized Prime Minister Modi for his silence on the Gaza war. He called it moral cowardice. Modi welcomed President Trump's new 20-point plan for Gaza. Congress leader Pawan Khera supported Ramesh's views. Khera emphasized the need for a Palestinian state. The plan aims for peace and security in the region. India recognized Palestine in 1988.

title: 'Ha bhai, aa gaya swaad': BJP roasts Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup title win
content: Abhishek Sharma delivered match-winning performances in the Asia Cup 2025, notably dominating Shaheen Shah Afridi. His extraordinary display earned him the Player of the Tournament award and a record-breaking 931 rating points in the ICC T20I Rankings, surpassing all previous records. The 25-year-old left-hander has firmly established himself as a top T20 batter.

title: Karur stampede fallout: TVK suspends Vijay's rallies; sets norms for key leaders
content: TVK has suspended Vijay's campaign trail across Tamil Nadu, canceling upcoming rallies and instructing district secretaries not to seek police permissions. This decision follows a stampede and legal issues, with Vijay expected to resume campaigning only by late October. Party functionaries are also advised to be cautious on social media.

title: Gold price hike: Akhilesh sees BJP hand; takes 'goldification' jab at Centre
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of gold hoarding. He termed this process "goldification." Yadav stated BJP leaders convert black money into gold. He linked this to rising gold prices. Yadav questioned government action on hoarders. He noted gold prices make ornaments unaffordable for many. Gold prices reached a new high in Delhi today. This impacts traditional practices.

title: Gaza peace: Hamas splits over Trump's plan - key demands of terror outfit
content: Hamas is deliberating on US President Donald Trump's 20-point peace plan, seeking amendments on disarmament and expulsion of cadres, despite Trump's 3-4 day ultimatum. The group is internally divided, with some favouring unconditional approval for a ceasefire while others demand significant reservations, particularly against disarmament and legitimising occupation. Discussions are ongoing.

title: 8 sixes and death stares! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's brutal assault on Australia bowlers
content: India's 14-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed the fourth-fastest Youth Test century, a breathtaking 78-ball hundred against Australia U19. He also broke the record for most career sixes in Youth ODI cricket and became the youngest centurion in IPL history, winning the Super Striker award in IPL 2025.

title: Happy Dussehra 2025: Top wishes, messages, quotes and images for Vijayadashami
content: Dussehra 2025, observed on October 2nd, marks the victory of good over evil, celebrating Lord Rama's triumph and Goddess Durga's conquest. This auspicious occasion brings families together to share heartfelt messages and participate in cultural events. The article provides heartwarming messages, inspiring quotes, and creative ideas to celebrate Dussehra with loved ones, emphasizing the importance of righteousness and virtue.

title: UP: 75-year-old man dies day after wedding; body sent for postmortem
content: A 75-year-old man in Jaunpur district married a 40-year-old widow on Monday but tragically died the following morning after a sudden health deterioration. Police are investigating the bizarre incident, and a postmortem is awaited to ascertain the cause of death and rule out any foul play. The man had remarried after his first wife's death, seeking companionship.

title: Festive cheer for central govt staff: Cabinet approves 3% DA, DR hike - details
content: Central government employees and pensioners will receive 3% hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) and Dearness Relief (DR), with Cabinet approving the hike. This biannual revision, aimed at offsetting inflation, will increase the DA/DR rate to 58%.

title: NCRB data: When crime numbers hide more than they reveal - decoded
content: Delhi is the country's crime capital with 1508.9 IPC cases per lakh population, while Jharkhand reports the fewest. However, Jharkhand's murder rate is significantly higher than Delhi's and Kerala's, suggesting widespread under-reporting of other crimes. This disparity highlights better policing and rigorous crime reporting in states like Delhi and Kerala.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: Encounter in Bareilly; 2 men of Tauqeer Raza held
content: UP Police arrested two associates of cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan following an encounter in Fatehganj Paschimi. The accused, Mohd Idris and Iqbal, had allegedly snatched a constable's anti-riot firearm and fired at police during a September 26 clash. Police recovered the stolen gun and other weapons, vowing continued action against those inciting unrest in Bareilly.

title: Virginia man suffers heart attack while driving, crashes at cardiologist‚Äôs office
content: A Virginia man survived a heart attack. He crashed his car outside a cardiologist's office. Dr Deepak Talreja, a heart specialist, revived him. Geraci had stopped breathing and lost pulse. His arteries showed severe blockages. Medical help arrived within eight minutes. Geraci is now recovering and changing his diet. He considers his survival a miracle.

title: Prince William, Kate face backlash over ‚Äòno-go zone‚Äô near Windsor home
content: Prince William and Kate Middleton‚Äôs new Windsor home is at the center of a row as a 150-acre exclusion zone closes popular routes in Windsor Great Park. Locals fear the royals are cutting off community access to public land.

title: First since 2019: US govt shuts down ‚Äì Why it‚Äôs more serious this time
content: The US government has entered its first shutdown since 2019, fueled by a bitter healthcare funding clash between President Trump and Democrats. Unlike previous standoffs, the administration is threatening permanent federal job cuts to reshape the workforce, sparking widespread anger.

title: BJP moves to consolidate votes in Bihar, to pull out Madhya Pradesh playbook
content: Bhojpuri singer Pawan Singh, whose independent candidacy led to NDA‚Äôs defeat in Karakat in 2024 Lok Sabha elections, has been pulled back into the party fold. The party is also planning to field many senior leaders, including Union Ministers, in the Assembly polls as it did in Madhya Pradesh

title: U.P. PGT exam postponed again; aspirants, Opposition slam government‚Äôs repeated delays
content: Students allege that this is the fifth time the examination, whose notification was released in April 2022, has been postponed, citing unavoidable reasons

title: Karnataka tops civic negligence deaths, says NCRB data
content: Civic negligence in Karnataka leads to 23 deaths in 2023, highlighting systemic issues and lack of accountability

title: Indian Railways to launch first assured-transit container train from Delhi to Kolkata in October
content: The bi-weekly service will run from Inland Container Depot (ICD) Tughlakabad in Delhi, to CONCOR‚Äôs CTCS terminal in Kolkata via Agra and Kanpur.

title: Which hitters are MVPs, LVPs of 2025?
content: four players hit 50 or more home runs this past season . DH/SP Shohei Ohtani and New York Yankees OF Aaron Judge were top picks in most every fantasy draft . it is hard to quantify the value for a player when a manager adds him to their roster .

title: Pereira was on the wrong side of UFC title history once; will that happen again?
content: ankalaev-Pereira 2 will be the first bout for both fighters since the belt changed hands . pereira dethroned pereira when they met in march . he will be aiming to regain the light heavyweight title on saturday .

title: Ranking every Women's Champions League kit in league phase
content: the UEFA women's champions league phase is scheduled to begin on Oct. 7 . it's time we assess the 2025-26 home, away, and third kits they'll be wearing while competing . we've got plain kits and patterned kits, kits inspired by landmarks and stadiums . some of the kits have hit the mark more than others this season .

title: What went wrong, what needs to happen next for U.S.
content: the americans lost 15-13 to the europeans in the 45th Ryder Cup . it's time to examine what went wrong and what needs to happen next . many of the european team expected to return at the next Ryder cup in 2027 .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Many top options at PG, C in points league draft tiers
content: the first round featured zero small forwards, one power forward and one shooting guard with four centers and four point guards . in that same draft, the fourth and eighth rounds were dominated by shooting guards and big men . this gives a quick snapshot of the trend we've been seeing in recent seasons .

title: ‚ÄòHe's fire on game day‚Äô: Why Stefon Diggs is emerging as ideal fit with Patriots
content: Stefon Diggs returns to Buffalo as his Patriots take on the bills in week 5 . the wide receiver is expected to return to his 11th NFL slam . he was signed to a three-year, $69 million contract in march .

title: Live UCL updates, analysis: Barca host PSG; Man City, Arsenal also in action
content: THE CHAMPIONS! Matchday 2 of the 2025-26  UEFA Champions League  season is here, and Wednesday's slate of matches is sure to entertain. Enjoy live updates of matches such as  Barcelona  vs.  Paris Saint-Germain ,  AS Monaco  vs.  Manchester City , and  Arsenal  vs.  Olympiacos .

title: Three-time All-Pro Leonard retiring with Colts
content: three-time All-Pro linebacker Shaquille Leonard is retiring as a member of the Indianapolis Colts . he will address fans at halftime of the game against the Las Vegas Raiders this Sunday . the 30-year-old was named the NFL's Defensive Rookie of the Year in 2018 .

title: Tracking MLB offseason manager changes: Snitker won't return -- who could Braves target?
content: the first managerial changes of the 2025-26 offseason came on the first day after the season . the San Francisco Giants dismissed Bob Melvin, the Minnesota Twins fired Rocco Baldelli, and the Texas Rangers announced that Bruce Bochy will not return . ESPN will track all of the managerial hirings and firings .
